title: Origen makes the 'perfect call' against KT Rolster
body: "I was really nervous at first," said Origen's captain Enrique "xPeke" Cedeño Martínez about heading into his final game in Week 1 of the 2015 World Championship Group Stage against KT Rolster.

replies.body:
As of now the region win rate is as follow
1. Korea --> 77.78% Win rate
2. NA      --> 66.67% Win rate
3. EU      --> 55.56% Win rate
4. CH     --> 33.33% Win rate
4. LMS  --> 33.33% Win rate
6. WC    -> 16.67% Win rate

"According to xPeke, he felt like Origen was in control the whole time. Except they weren't"
Except they were? Look at gold graph. They were slightly behind from 6 to 8 minutes, then even or ahead.
The problem is that they cannot see the total gold they have. And they were a lot behind them in kills, so the feeling is that you are loosing.

^^My thoughts exactly.  Reading what they said and then looking at the gold graph just didn't add up; KT never took a substantial lead of any kind, whereas Origen had fairly significant advantages for a good portion of the time.

Yea I had the exact same thought in my mind when I read that. I saw the match. It was obvious that even though KT had more kills early, OG was ahead in almost every aspect , gold, dragon, baron, turret kills and just overall shotcalling.

I think by "they" the author(s) meant KT maybe?
༼ つ ◕◕ ༽つ C9 TAKE MY ENERGY ༼ つ ◕◕ ༽つ
39:30 "I'm not Krepo but I'll take it."
It is so ironic how both 3rd seed teams from EU and NA are undefeated in their group. The other seeds are struggling. HAHA

I don't find it ironic honestly. I find it dumb that people keep referring to them as third seed as if they were bad teams. C9 got back to form, and Origen only made third seed because they weren't present in spring. The only thing that has surprised me is FNC's performance, and LGDs (THAT is ironic since they were dominating first seeds).

@Leah Jackson "Origen never let KT stay ahead for long, and **from the outside**, the game was a see-saw -- one team grabbed a lead -- the other snatched it back."  Did you mean "from the outset"?  Otherwise nice writeup

I meant from an outsider's perspective, as in-game, xPeke told me he didn't seem to think so. But in any case, thanks for bringing this to my attention and I've edited it a bit to make that a little more clear. Thanks for reading, and enjoy Worlds! :)
Red posts in E-Sports threads put major spoilers right on the Red Tracker.
no, he meant as a spectator
If OG win to TSM is in quarterfinals

So assuming Origen doesn't win anymore games, and a max of 12 wins total. There are only three ways they don't make it out of groups.

5 4 3 0. 5 3 3 1. 4 4 3 1. 4 3 3 2. And 3 3 3 3

Only Two of those wouldn't go to a tie breaker
and I guess there is also the 4 4 4 0 if Origen only wins one.

C9 however only has to deal with the 4 3 3 2 & the 3 3 3 3, either of which would end in a tiebreaker....

So.... C9 only has to win 1 of their 4 games next week to advance to quarterfinals. :D :D :D :D

the thing is that the 5 4 3 0 cant happen because that would require both kt and tsm to win 3 games and they cant since one of the games is between the two of them. All the other outcomes are possible
༼ つ ◕_◕ ༽つ C9 TAKE MY ENERGY ༼ つ ◕_◕ ༽つ

So assuming Origen doesnt win anymore games, and a max of 12 wins total. There are only Five ways they dont make it out of groups.

5 4 3 0. 5 3 3 1. 4 4 3 1. 4 3 3 2.  3 3 3 3.

Only Two of those wouldnt go to a tie breaker
i don't get how this makes sense? each team can get a best score of 6-0 in each group.... where are you getting 12 wins from?

There are 12 total games played in each group; that means twelve total wins.

At this point, the win totals are 3, 2, 1, 0.

If Origen wins none of their next three games, then the possibilities are 5 3 3 1 (if KT wins out, TSM wins out except against KT, and LGD wins against Origen), 4 4 3 1 (if TSM wins out, KT wins out except TSM, and LGD beats Origen), 4 3 3 2 (if TSM wins out, LGD wins out except against TSM, and KT wins against Origen OR if KT, TSM, and LGD each win two games in some combination with Origen winning none), or 3 3 3 3 (if LGD wins out, TSM wins out except LGD, and KT only beats Origen).  Only one of those (4 4  3 1) results in Origen not making it out of groups; the others all allow at least a tie-breaker.
to be honest i dont really think that calling baron when all 5 of the enmies are Bot is that much of a hard decision to make :D
It isn't. That's why OG said the game was given to them at that point.

I wasn't a fan of any team before the competition started, and really didn't know xPeke was in Origen, I just random "pickem"ed them in order of which team I had heard more of.
But accidentally I watched Origen first match, then I thought to myself, wow this is a solid team, full of capabilities. 
Their last match was very tight, but I don't think that they fell behind at all, they had more objectives and more overall gold.
 They just need one more win.
So I don't understand this whole 4 3 3 2 thing or whatever involving Origen and their chances of getting to the Quarterfinals. How many more wins would they have to get to qualify?
We want OG Skins or New FNC skins #Let'sGoEU !!
To generate the electricity
